column3: was one of the younger Ents of Fangorn Forest belonging to the people of Skinbark. His name was given because of uncharacteristic hastiness.

column1: The rowans-trees in his keeping (among them Carnimírië
column3: and Orofarnë) suffered greatly at the hands of Sarumans Orcs
column4: so he was the first ent to make his mind up at the Entmoot. He sheltered
column8: and Peregrin Took while the other ents made up their minds at the entmoot. He played a great part in the Ents resulting Battle of Isengard on Isengard.

column1: The name Quickbeam was given to him because he was hasty for an Ent. His Sindarin name
column4: derived from  *BERÉK- having to do with "violence

column1: Quickbeam and Quicken are actual English names of the "Rowans" or "mountain Ashes". It was not coincidental that "rowan" is mentioned in Quickbeams song.
2002: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers:
:http://lotrtcgwiki.com/wiki/lotr15034 A card in Deciphers The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game identifies one of the Ents at Isengard as Quickbeam.
2007: The Lord of the Rings Online:
:Quickbeam can be found in a grove in the far eastern side of Nan Curunír.
